info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 8:20PM CDT until June 12 at 10:15PM CDT by NWS Brownsville TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following county, Hidalgo.
* WHEN...Until 1015 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 820 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Weslaco, San Juan, Alamo, Donna, Elsa, Edcouch, La Villa, Maria Alicia P Munoz Elementary School, Olivarez, Midway North, Donna High School, La Blanca, Muniz, Mila Doce, Donna Police Department, Donna City Hall, Weslaco High School, Donna Public Library, Lyndon B Johnson Elementary School and Elsa Public Library. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CDT THIS EVENING
